p: Genistein (4′,5,7-trihydroxyflavone) (Fig. 8), is a naturally occurring phytoestrogen found mainly in soy foods and legumes including peas, lentils or beans, fava beans, lupin, tofu, kudzu, psoralea, red clover, coffee and some medical plants such as Flemingia vestita and Flemingia macrophylla root, [ 96].
